adjective.description: Satisfying one's conception of what is perfect; most suitable.
examples: the swimming pool is ideal for a quick dip
this is an ideal opportunity to save money

adjective.description: Existing only in the imagination; desirable or perfect but not likely to become a reality.
examples: in an ideal world, we might have made a different decision

noun.description: A person or thing regarded as perfect.
examples: you're my ideal of how a man should be

origin: Late Middle English (as a term in Platonic philosophy, in the sense existing as an archetype): from late Latin idealis, from Latin idea (see idea).
